data.text:
Obituary of Charles E. Harrington, IV

CHARLES E. HARRINGTON IV

Suddenly, on May 7, 2021 Chuck passed peacefully away at his home in Willingboro New Jersey at the young age of 47.

Son of the Late Charles E. Harrington III. Brother of the Late Tammy Staas-Stingel. Survived by his Mother Carol Staas-Harrington. His Siblings Christian E. Staas, Kelly Staas-Cuspilich and Stacey Staas-Filoon. Brother-in-Law Vincent Stingel and Francis Filoon. His Uncle Joseph and Aunt Kathy Harrington,Uncle James Harrison, Aunt Peggy Harrington-Alden, with many cousins from the Harrington-Staas Families. 13 Nieces, Nephews and 8 Grand Nieces and Nephews.

Chuck (Chuckles) was a graduate of Willingboro High School in 1991. He served our country in the Army National Guard from 1994-2002. Chuck continued his education and received a BS in Arts and Science as a History Major from Rutgers University, Camden. Chuck loved his family, friends and adorned cats Girl, Jake, Callie and the Late Rocky. He will be missed by all that had a chance to know him. He was funny and had a great heart. His happiness was clearly shown during his time serving our nation in the Military and his love of Ancestry and Travel.

If you knew Chuck, you know that he always had a story to tell or a jaw dropping joke. He wore a smile that was contagious. He will be in Our Hearts and Loved Immensely Forever!

In lieu of Flowers, please make a donation in Chuck's name to the Burlington County Animal Shelter located at 35 Academy Drive, Westampton Township, NJ 08060

https://www.co.burlington.nj.us/168/animatl-shelter
